urls.title: The Prime Minister visits Didsbury following Storm Christoph
urls.description: This week, Storm Christoph brought heavy rain to very wet ground and full rivers. Today, I joined the Prime Minister who visited Didsbury in Greater Manchester where properties were evacuated. When we arrived the channel leading to the flood storage ‚Ä¶

tweets.text: Yesterday with the PM I visited Didsbury where properties were evacuated following #StormChristoph. @EnvAgency‚Äôs flood defences held firm and 23,000 properties in Greater Manchester were protected. Here‚Äôs a blog about that + how it relates to #COP26: https://t.co/1BXemM9lnp https://t.co/0WakFBAJbk

Happy #WorldWetlandsDay2021 ü¶Ü We are celebrating today and are delighted to announce that we are extending the size of the #LDV National Nature Reserve by an additional 136 ha - in partnership with Carstairs Countryside Trust. Exciting news! @NaturalEngland @NEYorksNLincs https://t.co/BQoN51Ls9B

@SMGHaryana @UNEP @EnvAgency @nature ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡§ø ‡§ï‡•ã ‡§¨‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•á ‡§ï‡•á ‡§≤‡§ø‡§è ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡§ø ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§¶‡•á‡§∂üå≥üí¶ https://t.co/HUq96ruZKq

urls.title: Collection | River & Rowing Museum
urls.description: Donate to the Museum The River & Rowing Museum holds over 20,000 items covering the international sport of rowing, the history of Henley on Thames, the story of the River Thames, the children‚Äôs book The Wind in the Willows and the Modern British artist John Piper. This includes objects, books, ephemera, archival material, artworks and‚Ä¶ Read More

tweets.text: View of the River Thames from the Museum. Don't worry, the #Museum is safe and dry. @EnvAgencySE are recommending we ALL stay safe and dry and don't take your daily exercise along the river bank today.  Enjoy the #Museumfromhome today with a cuppa! https://t.co/9KlprJ0TBB https://t.co/BvlFYDsEfh

Brilliant article on why natural methods should and are being used for flood mitigation in Coggeshall instead of the @envagency hopping into bed with an aggregates company to quarry out a hillside for sand and gravel to fund an unwanted and unnecessary 300metre dam https://t.co/5OznvLNOQQ

Appropriately on #WorldWetlandsDay I'm drafting the first case study of estuarine #rewilding to appear on @RewildingB network pages - @WWTSteart. Astonishing carbon sequestration figs and biodiversity benefits emerging from this @EnvAgency flood risk management project. https://t.co/qX0Rd7eLez

urls.title: East of England‚Äôs unique chalk streams to benefit from ¬£300million of fast-tracked environmental investment | Anglian Water Services
urls.description: Today, Anglian Water is announcing plans to fast track ¬£300 million of investment specifically targeted at environmental improvements, river restoration projects and wetland treatment schemes.

tweets.text: Happy #WorldWetlandsDay! We're really proud of our Ingoldisthorpe Treatment Wetland in Norfolk which is managed by @N_Rivers_Trust - and we're very excited that ¬£300m will now be going into more river and wetland projects https://t.co/VQtqgSCFKx https://t.co/VT4LnSXbqL

Please don‚Äôt drive through flood water  
1. Just 30cm can float an average family-sized car 
2. It's the #1 cause of death during flooding 
3. Over ¬æ of cars rescued from floods have to be written off 
4. Just 1 egg-cup of water sucked into your engine will wreck it 
Convinced? https://t.co/G9MqMVgSaC

Weather permitting @EnvAgencySW  will shortly be carrying out repairs to tracks around Kenwith Valley Reservoir ‚Äì Bideford to fix deficiencies from general use consisting of eroded / rutted surfaces & isolated potholes
 
Track access restricted so please observe diversion signs https://t.co/DLfkXLzbMl

We are looking for flood wardens & members of flood groups across Yorkshire to take part in our communicating flood risk project. This would involve a 1 hour zoom call with the project team. Please get in touch if you would like to be involved! #floods #floodaware #floodwarden https://t.co/UobxLMVjOh

With more rain expected over the coming days please keep across the @OxfordshireCC website and the @EnvAgency for information about road closures and flooding updates in our district https://t.co/utGGmAWCxl

Road Policing continues. This is a light goods waste movement operation with our EA partners @EnvAgencySE. Scrap metal, hazardous material, roadworthiness and document checks along with appropriate waste licences. This is in Portsmouth today. #JOUCVU https://t.co/HwmxLuk1jZ

With more rain expected over the coming days please keep across the @OxfordshireCC website and the @EnvAgency for information about road closures and flooding updates in our district https://t.co/JPXbq7AB9g

urls.title: Cold weather and flooding in Oxfordshire
urls.description: River levels in Oxfordshire remain¬†high after recent rainfall with some flood warnings remaining on sections of¬†the River Thames and multiple¬†flood alerts still in place. Meanwhile the very cold temperatures now evident in Oxfordshire remain¬†in the forecasts for February.Met Office informationThe Met Office issues weather warnings when severe co...

tweets.text: Just a reminder that rivers remain exceptionally high with parts of the Rivers Thames, Windrush, Cherwell, Thame &  Ray under Flood Warnings and many other Flood Alerts. This page signposts you to key info from the Met Office & Environment Agency. https://t.co/1sVcMap97E https://t.co/kuEOFbrQff

urls.title: Successful first year for waste crime taskforce despite pandemic
urls.description: The Joint Unit for Waste Crime celebrates its first anniversary of cracking down on criminals and gangs who commit serious and organised waste crime.

tweets.text:
#WasteCrime harms our environment, community and economy.
 
We joined forces with partners to form the Joint Unit for Waste Crime, to share intelligence and work in innovative ways to disrupt waste criminals. 
 
Here's what we've achieved after 1 year üëá
https://t.co/sYwoOeE6Xu https://t.co/1xEw3TwkRU

urls.title: Social Ecological Dynamics of Catchment Resilience
urls.description: Catchment resilience is the capacity of a combined social ecological system, comprised of water, land, ecological resources and communities in a river basin, to deal with sudden shocks and gradual changes, and to adapt and self-organize for progressive change and transform itself for sustainability. This paper proposes that analysis of catchments as social ecological systems can provide key insights into how social and ecological dynamics interact and how some of the negative consequences of unsustainable resource use or environmental degradation can be ameliorated. This requires recognition of the potential for community resilience as a core element of catchment resilience, and moves beyond more structural approaches to emphasize social dynamics. The proposals are based on a review of social ecological systems research, on methods for analyzing community resilience, and a review of social science and action research that suggest ways of generating resilience through community engageme

Prospect members at @EnvAgency have been on the frontline providing flooding-related services, from prevention to early warning and clean-up.

Read @Garry_Graham1's blog on how these essential workers are protecting their communities #WeAreProspect ‚úä https://t.co/tHqc8zbddJ

Hushed up in the 90s, #Capperpass since admitted their actions of dumping tonnes of contaminated over the area. The long lasting affects have been found through an @EnvAgency research project in the area, which found toxins & heavy metals. Why are they churning up the soil? https://t.co/ANFGzlYwHj

The construction of the huge Amazon distribution centre is going ahead regardless of valid local residents objections, destruction to habitats and increased future flood risk. Job creation? No, it‚Äôs all about money

tweets.text:
@WGEnviroAgri With the River Dee / other watercourses being at or close to the England / Wales border, how do you account for / record and manage cross border incidents - e.g. if pollution source in England, but incident detected Wales and vice-versa?
@NatResWales @EnvAgency

@joypenzer @westrowhendo @55motown @HelenLarkin11 @RossDunc @ClaireDinger @JuliaBradbury @ArroJoanne @friends_earth @energyestuary @EnvAgencyYNE @East_Riding @BadgerTrust @Humberbeat @HullRebellion @XR_BSE @BarnOwlTrust @ChrisGPackham @BBCSpringwatch @Wykeland @RSPCA_official @AmazonUK @DavidDavisMP @bbcburnsy Haydock were promised 5000 jobs at committee and they only got 250, only 16 of these people were local. We‚Äôve seen the same at Hoo & Bowburn!!

We are so excited to be part of #Landscapes2Lifescapes interactive digital exhibition, launching tomorrow! 
Join the @thefloodhub @SociologyLancs @EEIatHull @EnvAgency on 3 February to bring you online content about how flooding affects us all. #UKEdChat #FloodAware #SciComm https://t.co/0ic2HeOfgA

urls.title: Flood management without concrete since 1220
urls.description: Coggeshall Abbey was founded on the banks of the river Blackwater in 1140 by King Stephen of England and Matilda of Boulogne.¬†¬†It has a long history of natural flood management.

tweets.text: Coggeshall Abbey - a shining example of working with the environment to manage flooding. No need for a 300m wide concrete dam and 400 acre quarry: https://t.co/5hHZksix21
